channel.title: Landscape editor not displaying objects
channel.description:
Yes I am currently getting an issue with the RSC Community Landscape Editor.
Currently its not displaying objects at all and would like to know a way to fix this issue.
Here is the DOS lines I get after I run my editor maybe som1 can figure this out as I cant find any fixes any where.
C:\Users\Owner\Desktop\RSC Project\landscape editor>java -cp lib/xstream.jar;lib /xpp3.jar;mapeditor.jar com.GUI Error: Cannot construct com.data.GameObjectLoc as it does not have a no-args con structor ---- Debugging information ---- message : Cannot construct com.data.GameObjectLoc as it does not hav e a no-args constructor line number : 2 path : /linked-list/GameObjectLoc cause-message : Cannot construct com.data.GameObjectLoc as it does not hav e a no-args constructor class : java.util.LinkedList cause-exception : com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.reflection.ObjectAcces sException required-type : com.data.GameObjectLoc ------------------------------- com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.ConversionException: Cannot construct com.da ta.GameObjectLoc as it does not have a no-args constructor ---- Debugging information ---- message : Cannot construct com.data.GameObjectLoc as it does not hav e a no-args constructor line number : 2 path : /linked-list/GameObjectLoc cause-message : Cannot construct com.data.GameObjectLoc as it does not hav e a no-args constructor class : java.util.LinkedList cause-exception : com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.reflection.ObjectAcces sException required-type : com.data.GameObjectLoc ------------------------------- at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.TreeUnmarshaller.convertAnother(TreeUnm arshaller.java:45) at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.ReferenceByXPathUnmarshaller.convertAno ther(ReferenceByXPathUnmarshaller.java:39) at com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.collections.AbstractCollectionCon verter.readItem(AbstractCollectionConverter.java:82) at com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.collections.CollectionConverter.p opulateCollection(CollectionConverter.java:60) at com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.collections.CollectionConverter.u nmarshal(CollectionConverter.java:53) at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.TreeUnmarshaller.convertAnother(TreeUnm arshaller.java:38) at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.ReferenceByXPathUnmarshaller.convertAno ther(ReferenceByXPathUnmarshaller.java:39) at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.TreeUnmarshaller.start(TreeUnmarshaller .java:99) at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.ReferenceByXPathMarshallingStrategy.unm arshal(ReferenceByXPathMarshallingStrategy.java:12) at com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream.unmarshal(XStream.java:552) at com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream.unmarshal(XStream.java:540) at com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream.fromXML(XStream.java:497) at com.PersistenceManager.load(PersistenceManager.java:34) at com.Util.prepareData(Util.java:316) at com.Canvas.init(Canvas.java:78) at com.Canvas.<init>(Canvas.java:56) at com.GUI.<init>(GUI.java:40) at com.GUI.main(GUI.java:46) Caused by: com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.reflection.ObjectAccessException: Cannot construct com.data.GameObjectLoc as it does not have a no-args construct or at com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.reflection.PureJavaReflectionProv ider.newInstance(PureJavaReflectionProvider.java:50) at com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.reflection.ReflectionConverter.in stantiateNewInstance(ReflectionConverter.java:148) at com.thoughtworks.xstream.converters.reflection.ReflectionConverter.un marshal(ReflectionConverter.java:90) at com.thoughtworks.xstream.core.TreeUnmarshaller.convertAnother(TreeUnm arshaller.java:38) ... 17 more

item.title: Landscape editor not displaying objects
item.dc:creator: @moomanchoo moomanchoo
item.description:
@moomanchoo wrote:

Okay sweet fixed it thanks guys know how do I remove the objects? I am not using the 3D version I am using an old version since I can’t find workable new landscape editors.

Now when I hit compile it removes the mapeditor.jar which then I cant run my map editor. So know what is wrong…

Read full topic

item.title: Landscape editor not displaying objects
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

-Nothing:

Do what I said, Install JDK 6U25 instead of JDK 7.

or change target=“1.5”

Read full topic

item.title: Landscape editor not displaying objects
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

Once I tried to run a server with JDK 7, and similar errors came up, so I’m pretty sure it’s the problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Landscape editor not displaying objects
item.dc:creator: @moomanchoo moomanchoo
item.description:
@moomanchoo wrote:

Tried that didnt fix it…I may uninstall all the java related stuff then reinstall see if that fixed the issue. If that doesnt fix it then I have no clue what to do…

item.title: Landscape editor not displaying objects
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

Do what I said, Install JDK 6U25 instead of JDK 7.

item.title: Landscape editor not displaying objects
item.dc:creator: @moomanchoo moomanchoo
item.description:
@moomanchoo wrote:

I think its pc side issue as I am trying the Landscape editor on another pc and it is showing all the objects on this pc but wont display on my pc so just need to figure out what i did wrong. It was working fine until I started dinking around trying to get the EasyRSC server to run so i can get indepth designing of a landscape after 30mins of trying to figure out why it wouldnt run I go back to the landscape editor and desided ill start just going by a view from my mind. Then come to find out the landscape editor would not load the game objects…

Read full topic

item.title: Landscape editor not displaying objects
item.dc:creator: @latifundio latifundio
item.description:
@latifundio wrote:

Did you compiled from last revision? i think it is r53.

Also did you got a folder named “xml” with the GameObjectLoc.xml.gz file inside?

Anyway here is a build file so you can compile with ant.

[code]

<property name="src" location="src" />
<property name="build" location="build" />
<property name="lib" location="lib" />
<property name="jar" location="editor.jar" />

<target name="compile">
	<delete file="${jar}" />
	<mkdir dir="${build}" />
	<javac srcdir="${src}" destdir="${build}" debug="on" target="1.5">
	  <classpath>
		<pathelement location="${lib}/xpp3.jar" />
		<pathelement location="${lib}/xstream.jar"/>
		<pathelement path="${java.class.path}/"/>
	  </classpath>
	</javac>
	<jar basedir="${build}" destfile="${jar}" />
	<delete dir="${build}" />
</target>

<target name="run">
	<java classname="com.Gui" fork="true">
		<classpath>
			<pathelement location="${lib}/xpp3.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/xstream.jar" />
			<pathelement path="${jar}/" />
		</classpath>
	</java>
</target>

[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Landscape editor not displaying objects
item.dc:creator: @moomanchoo moomanchoo
item.description:
@moomanchoo wrote:

would that be java JDK 6? or am I missing something if you dont mind please feel free to post a link for this 1.6

Read full topic

item.title: Landscape editor not displaying objects
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

Install JDK 1.6 instead of 1.7.

Read full topic
